Dòmine. ^ Out of the depths I have crie: exáŭdi vocem meam~; fiant aŭres tuaĕ intendèntes in vocem deprecatiónis meaĕ. ^ Lord
hear my voice~; let thy ears be attentive to the voice of my supplication.

1 ^ De profùndîs clamávi ad te: 4 ^ Qŭia apud te propitiátio est. ^ For with thee there is merciful forgiveness.

Dòmine. ^ Out of the depths I have crie: Dòmine~; sustìnuit ánima mea in verbo ejus. ^ By reason of thy law
column4: O Lord~; my soul hath relied on his word.

1 ^ De profùndîs clamávi ad te: 6 ^ Sperávit ánima mea in Dòmino a custódia matutína usqŭe ad noctem~; speret Isráhel in Dòmino. ^ My soul hath hoped in the Lord from the morning watch even until night~; let Israel hope in the Lord.

Dòmine. ^ Out of the depths I have crie: et copiósa apud eum redèmptio. ^ Because with the Lord there is mercy

1 ^ De profùndîs clamávi ad te: 8 ^ Et ipse rèdimet Israhélem ex òmnibus iniqŭitátibus ejus. ^ And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
